title: Errors in config.yaml formatting or content are not reported comprehensively

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I had an syntax error in my ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml file, which gave some
invalid name (a full path) instead of a shorter name.
I tried to install "hpctoolkit+mpi" and it failed trying to build openmpi with the confusing error:
```console
==> Installing util-macros
==> Searching for binary cache of util-macros
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for util-macros found: installing from source
==> Error: TypeError: sequence item 2: expected string, NoneType found

/home/msi3/hpct/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:792, in child_process:
        789            tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        790
        791            # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    792            # show that, too.
        793            package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        794
        795            build_log = None
```
That was the first prerequisite that needed building.  Same thing happened trying to install
using a target clause.

spack should report that the compiler module was incorrect, or that the compiler
could not be found, or something, rather than a python error on a comment line.
